title: Apple Pencil doesn't draw straight on repaired iPads; the engineer's perspective vs. the repairman's

Timestamps:
00:00 - Intro
03:58 - Why people are mad at marcan?
05:26 - Why do we distrust or assume the worst of Apple?
05:33 - Apple lobbyists speaking disingenuously to legislators
06:50 - Error 53
07:40 - Error 53 had nothing to do with security
08:15 - If Apple doesn't know how their devices work - how should we?
08:50 - Why Error 53 NEVER passed the smell test as a "security feature"
10:50 - Distinction between Apple's error vs. independent's error
11:35 - No anti-intellectualism
11:55 - Even if the repairman was wrong about the why, he's right about the outcome
12:18 - Where we're coming from
12:55 - Let's discuss the engineering decisions
14:10 - This ends the same way regardless of who at Apple did it
14:50 - Apple's history of unnecessary decisions cutting against repair
15:05 - Apple's hiding of error codes/diagnostics
16:20 - WE HAVE NO INFORMATION ON HOW THESE DEVICES WORK!
17:18 - Apple's own techs think the charge port is attached to the motherboard
17:50 - What we're asking for - open lines of communication
18:14 - The first time isn't malice - the 10000th time is
18:55 - Apple's repair systems are bad, that's not malicious
19:25 - When it happens 10k+ times and you ignore it, it's malicious
20:03 - I understand & respect Marcan's point
20:20 - I'm not throwing the repair person under the bus, because Apple created this situation to begin with
21:02 - We could put all of this aside and start from scratch.
22:51 - Conclusion: how I WISH I could reply to journalists
25:53 - A sad attempt to shill merch

Timestamps:
00:00 - Intro
00:28 - In repair, trust is everything
01:35 - The issue
03:05 - Microscope footage of the damage to the phone
04:15 - What drivesavers told the customer. 
05:45 - Why I blame drivesavers more than apple
07:09 - Why we do what we do
08:00 - The drivesavers referral from Apple needs to end
08:10 - Drivesavers is not being honest about what they are doing
09:05 - This is systemic and happens constantly
09:35 - This damages Apple as well as us!
10:15 - How I think Apple fell into this arrangement
11:22 - I think Apple may not even know their customers are being scammed by their referral partner
12:14 - I realize this is tactless
12:25 - This is known within the repair industry
14:57 - I feel guilty about a bad estimate from 2010
16:14 - Referral/affiliate network has blunted us from calling it out
17:15 - WHAT REPAIR SHOPS NEED TO DO ABOUT IT!
18:35 - Apple and us have shared interest in solving this

The contents of this video are my personal opinion - yours may vary.
